For a southern NHRO orbit about L2 (don't remember the period in days, period is the last number):
1.0269694420519750E+0, -1.0620425026230252E-26, -1.8530606468865049E-1, 1.8339007690300910E-14, -1.1378551488655682E-1, 1.3151545077882733E-13, 1.5763752384473892E+0

For a southern NHRO orbit about L1 (don't remember the period in days, period is the last number):
9.2280005557282274E-1, 1.6386233489716853E-28, -2.1575768509057866E-1, 4.4327633188679963E-13, 1.2826547451754347E-1, 2.4299327620081873E-12, 1.8036720655626510E+0

For the same orbit as in Murakami's article (southern L2 halo orbit with a 14.8 day period):
1.1340389525913128E+0, -1.9603275922757012E-28, -3.1177930540447237E-33, 5.3802690301291542E-15, 1.1050885595242482E-1, 4.2488243310471582E-33, 3.3898323438578979E+0
